page.title: 01The Fertile Earth of Preston
page.content: The village sits in the middle with the surrounding ground generally flat and covered in rich, fertile soil. The main occupation therefore is agricultural, work being on the many small holdings, fruit farms (apples, pears and soft fruit) and arable farms. The population is approx 600. A small typical village school with 72 pupils age 5-11+ serves the area. A recent baby boom has increased the young population. A village hall is used by many villagers belonging to the organisations flourishing here. Behind the hall and school is a recreation ground with swing and slides and also cricket and football pitches. The area is fortunate to have a general village store, a post office and a butchers shop. So many villages
